movies.title: Cherish
movies.plot: As a man goes through his morning ritual of bathing and cleaning up, he can only see around him images of his former partner and can only think of the good times the two had together. As the man gets more and more somber, he finally hears a voice for his former partner to tell him to go. The man, coming back to reality, goes to the appointment he has that day where many more will remember his former partner.
movies.simplePlot: A club boy loses his love.

biography.bio: John Adam is an actor and director, known for Summer Bay (1988), City Homicide, l'enfer du crime (2007) and Les traces du mal (1998).
biography.name: John Adam

biography.bio: Russell Page grew up in Brisbane as the youngest of 12 siblings in a worker class family. When he was 15 years old, he had to decide between Rugby (Queensland State Rugby) and dancing; in difference to the rest of the family his father wanted him to choose the rugby career ... until he saw him dancing. Russell was educated at the Aboriginal Islander Dance Theatre in Sydney and graduated in 1989. He was the first artist with a performance in the Prime Minister's private courtyard (Parliament House in Canberra). In 2001 he joined 'Bangarra Dance Theater' (where 2 brothers are still choreographer and composer respectively), where he became a star. There he also performed with Rayma Johnson, later his wife. Kick (1999) was the only "long" film he acted a lead, although he was engaged in several short films and video-clips. When he died, he left a son and two daughters. his oldest child, son Rhimi, is a guest performer at Bangarra Dance Theatre.
biography.name: Russell Page
